Name: HMS Lance
Fate: Damaged by bombs on 5 and 9 April 1942.  Declared a constructive total loss and scrapped.
Badge: Badge: On a Field barry wavy of four White and Blue, issuant from the base a Lance Red.
Propulsion:
Two shafts
Two geared steam turbines
Two drum-type boilers
48000 shp (35.8 MW)
Range: 5,500 nmi (10,200 km; 6,300 mi) at 15 knots (28 km/h; 17 mph)
Armament:
4 × twin[1] QF 4-inch (102 mm) Mk XVI guns
1 × quadruple QF 2 pdr Mk VIII L/39 (40 mm)
2 × quadruple QF 0.5 in Mk III Vickers (12.7 mm)
2 × quadruple 21 inch (533 mm) torpedoes torpedo tubes
